constant.name: no-route
constant.doc: Returned when RabbitMQ sends back with 'basic.return' when a 'mandatory' message cannot be delivered to any queue.

field.name: reason
field.label: Block reason
field.doc: The reason the connection was blocked.

field.name: nowait
field.label: do not send a reply method
field.doc: If set, the server will not respond to the method. The client should not wait for a reply method. If the server could not complete the method it will raise a channel or connection exception.

field.name: ticket
field.label: Deprecated, must be ``0``
field.doc: Deprecated value that must be zero.

field.name: cluster-id
field.label: Deprecated, must be empty
field.doc: Deprecated value that must be empty.

field.name: internal
field.label: Deprecated, must be ``False``
field.doc: Deprecated value that must be False.

field.name: out-of-band
field.label: Protocol level field, do not use, must be ``0``.
field.doc: Used when negotiating a connection on an out-of-band channel. Do not use, must be zero.

field.name: insist
field.label: Deprecated, must be ``False``
field.doc: Deprecated value that must be False.

field.name: known-hosts
field.label: Deprecated, must be empty
field.doc: Deprecated value that must be zero.

field.name: auto-delete
field.label: Automatically delete when not in use
field.doc: If set, the queue is deleted when all consumers have finished using it. The last consumer can be cancelled either explicitly or because its channel is closed. If there was no consumer ever on the queue, it won't be deleted. Applications can explicitly delete auto-delete queues using the Delete method as normal.

field.name: channel-id
field.label: Deprecated, must be empty
field.doc: Deprecated value that must be empty.

field.name: capabilities
field.label: Deprecated, must be empty
field.doc: Deprecated value that must be empty.
